definition: to get to know each other/acquaintance
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship
pinyin: bu4 da3 bu4 cheng2 xiang1 shi2

sentences.english: I met Akmal in Warsaw about two-and-a-half years ago on a protest organised by Polish nurses.
sentences.chinese: 兩年半前，我和阿克毛在一個抗議活動中相識。

sentences.english: The acquaintances were unworthy of her.
sentences.chinese: 這些相識的人都配不上她。

sentences.english: Jordan and Prieto are reported to have met last summer.
sentences.chinese: 據悉，二人去年夏天相識。

sentences.english: I show that he had many Jewish acquaintances in Vienna, despite his writing in Mein Kampf that he was sickened by the sight of the Jews he saw there.
sentences.chinese: 我可以告訴你，他在維也納也有許多相識的猶太人。

sentences.english: They conversed with the familiarity of a long-established acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他們儼然如老相識一樣親密無間地攀談了。

sentences.english: Once we dreamt that we were strangers.
sentences.chinese: 死生契闊有一次，我們夢見大家都是不相識的。

sentences.english: From the acquaintance, to the death, he and cherishes constantly to her sympathizing .
sentences.chinese: 從相識，至死亡，他對她的體貼和愛護始終如一。

sentences.english: On that day, due to Yihe's introduction, I firstly met Haizi.
sentences.chinese: 那一天，因駱一禾引見，我與海子初次相識。

sentences.english: But the lottery of friendship could even depend on who we happen to meet first.
sentences.chinese: 但這種緣分甚至可能還取決於相識的先後順序。

sentences.english: Komi hirose to guelph too tells the story of love he met Richard garments.
sentences.chinese: 廣瀨給圭太講述了他和理衣相識相愛的故事。

sentences.english: All products are purchased from acquaintance fellow villagers so that products have high quality.
sentences.chinese: 所有產品收購於鄰近相識的父老鄉親，品質有保障。

sentences.english: I met my ex in a Weight Watchers meeting, of all places.
sentences.chinese: 我和前女友偏偏是在一家減肥中心相識的。

sentences.english: I do not know you so I can not say if I have love for you in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我們仍然素不相識，因此我還不能肯定是否真心愛你。

sentences.english: Know my husband when we are of marriageable age.
sentences.chinese: 相識我老公時我們都已經是婚齡年歲了。

sentences.english: English can help us understand⑤ many new books and movies.
sentences.chinese: 英語能幫手我們相識許多書戰影戲。

sentences.english: On the other side compartments, Jenny and practicing very congenial, feel capable of deja vu.
sentences.chinese: 另邊廂，珍妮與力行非常投契，感覺得力行似曾相識。

definition: to get to know sb/to meet sb for the first time
to form ties/to become attached (to sb, sth)
fate or chance that brings people together/predestined affinity or relationship/(Budd.) destiny
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to see each other/to meet in person
